htmlcss__resources.title: GRID Game
htmlcss__resources.description: Grid Garden is a game to practice all grid properties. You will be in charge of growing a carrot garden.

htmlcss__resources.title: FLEXBOX Game
htmlcss__resources.description: Flexbox Froggy is a game to practice all flexbox properties. You have to help the frogs reach their destination.

htmlcss__resources.title: HTML Cheatsheet
htmlcss__resources.description: Cheatsheet with all HTML properties, atributes and tags. It also includes interactive tools to generate code snippets.

htmlcss__resources.title: 100 days CSS challenge
htmlcss__resources.description: Web with 100 CSS challenges. You can record your progress and see other users' solutions. All solutions uploaded in each challenge are also available.

htmlcss__resources.title: CSS animations generator
htmlcss__resources.description: This tool allows you to generate any CSS animation in a intuitive way by selecting all its properties. Once the animation is created, you can copy the code to add it to your project.

htmlcss__resources.title: 8 simple CSS transitions
htmlcss__resources.description: Web with 8 CSS transitions to apply in divs or buttons. You can see the transition visualisation and copy the code into your project.

htmlcss__resources.title: CSS tools examples
htmlcss__resources.description: This web contains a guide with visual examples of all CSS tools. It explains them with illustrated and animated examples.

htmlcss__resources.title: CSS elements templates
htmlcss__resources.description: This tool contains visual templates of some HTML elements: buttons, checkboxes, toggle switches, cards, loaders and inputs. You can sign in with GitHub to upload your own templates.

htmlcss__resources.title: CSS speedrun
htmlcss__resources.description: This webs allows you to practice CSS selectors. In each level you have to write the selector to select the indicated item.

htmlcss__challenges.title: Product preview card component
htmlcss__challenges.description: Your challenge is to build out a responsive product preview card component and get it looking as close to the design as possible.
requeriments: The card has to contain: image, product name, product description, price and 'Add to cart' button
View the layout according to the screen size of your device

htmlcss__challenges.title: Fylo data storage component
htmlcss__challenges.description: Your challenge is to build out a data storage component.
requeriments: Counter with available storage and storage used
View the layout according to the screen size of your device
Add loading animations with the data storage bar

htmlcss__challenges.title: QR code component
htmlcss__challenges.description: Your challenge is to build out this QR code component.
requeriments: View the layout according to the screen size of your device
The component will have QR code image to link to destination page
Use a pre-processor for styles as Sass, Less or Stylus

htmlcss__challenges.title: Order summary component
htmlcss__challenges.description: Your challenge is to build out a order summary card component.
requeriments: The card will have all products added with teir prices and the total price
View the layout according to the screen size of your device
Use a pre-processor for styles as Sass, Less or Stylus

htmlcss__challenges.title: Testimonials grid section
htmlcss__challenges.description: Your challenge is to build a testimonial grid section.
requeriments: Use grid to display the cards
Each card will have an opinion about a product and the author's photo and name
View the layout according to the screen size of your device

htmlcss__challenges.title: Rating component
htmlcss__challenges.description: Your challenge is to build a rating component.
requeriments: Component will have information about a product, 5 buttons with score and a submit button
Hover effects for all buttons
View the layout according to the screen size of your device

htmlcss__challenges.title: Clock app
htmlcss__challenges.description: Your challenge is to build out a clock application.
requeriments: Component will have the hour, location, day of the week, day of the year and week number.
Use flexbox for components distribution.
View the layout according to the screen size of your device

javascript__resources.title: Javascript exercises
javascript__resources.description: Hundreds of exercises to improve programming logic in more than 20 languages, including Javascript.

javascript__resources.title: Public APIs for projects
javascript__resources.description: Hundreds of public APIs for your next project. There are some APIs types: REST, GraphQL, Kafka, SOAP, RapidQL...

javascript__resources.title: Library for dates and times
javascript__resources.description: LUXON is a powerful, modern and friendly wrapper for Javascript dates and times. It includes native time zones and Intl support.

javascript__resources.title: Library for form validations
javascript__resources.description: VEST is a library that allows declarative and production-optimised form validation. Vest adopts the syntax and style of unit testing frameworks, so you can leverage the knowledge you already have to write your form validations.

javascript__resources.title: Javascript design patterns
javascript__resources.description: This guide includes the main design patterns in javascript. It includes an extensive description of each with examples and code snippets.

javascript__resources.title: Course with 15 Javascript projects
javascript__resources.description: You will learn how to consume different REST APIS with JSON and Fetch API + Async / Await, one of the most important topics as a JavaScript developer. You will learn new concepts in ES6 such as template literals, arrow functions, generators, iterators, promises, async / await and more.

javascript__resources.title: Javascript interview questions
javascript__resources.description: Repository to practice the most frequently asked questions in Javascript technical interviews. It includes a long list of questions with explanations.

javascript__challenges.title: Tic Tac Toe
javascript__challenges.description: Your challenge is to build Tic Tac Toe classic game
requeriments: Save the game state in the browser so that it’s preserved if the player refreshes their browser
See hover states for all interactive elements on the page
Play the game either solo vs the computer or multiplayer against another person.
View the optimal layout for the game depending on their device's screen size

javascript__challenges.title: Calculator app
javascript__challenges.description: Your challenge is to build out a calculator app
requeriments: Perform mathematical operations like addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division
Have their initial theme preference checked using prefers-color-scheme and have any additional changes saved in the browser
See the size of the elements adjust based on their device's screen size

javascript__challenges.title: Rock, paper, scissors game
javascript__challenges.description: Your challenge is to build out this Rock, Paper, Scissors game.
requeriments: Play Rock, Paper, Scissors against the computer
Maintain the state of the score after refreshing the browser
View the optimal layout for the game depending on their device's screen size

javascript__challenges.title: REST Countries API
javascript__challenges.description: Your challenge is integrating with the REST Countries API to pull country data and display it.
requeriments: Show all countries from the API on the homepage
Search for a country using an input field
Filter countries by region
Click on a country to see more detailed information on a separate page

javascript__challenges.title: Mole Buster
javascript__challenges.description: Your challenge is to build the classic game 'Mole Buster'
requeriments: Display the player's final score
Buttons to stop and restart the game
Input to choose the speed of the moles

javascript__challenges.title: Expenses chart component
javascript__challenges.description: In this challenge, you'll create a bar chart component from scratch.
requeriments: View the bar chart and hover over the individual bars to see the correct amounts for each day
See the current day's bar highlighted in a different colour to the other bars
See hover states for all interactive elements on the page

javascript__challenges.title: Memory game
javascript__challenges.description: In this challenge, you'll create a the classic card matching game.
requeriments: Play the Memory game either solo or multiplayer (up to 4 players)
Set the theme to use numbers or icons within the tiles
Choose to play on either a 6x6 or 4x4 grid
View the optimal layout for the game depending on their device's screen size

javascript__challenges.title: Pomodoro app
javascript__challenges.description: Your challenge is to build out a Pomodoro timer app.
requeriments: Set a Pomodoro timer and short & long break timers
Customize how long each timer runs for
See a circular progress bar that updates every minute and represents how far through their timer they are
Customize the appearance of the app with the ability to set preferences for colors and fonts

angular__resources.title: Real AngularJS application
angular__resources.description: Now it's time to see the 'guts' of a working AngularJS application in the real world. The best example is the code developed by Peter Bacon Darwin and Pawel Kozlowski for the book Mastering Web Application with AngularJS . The source code is available on GitHub and we can see the directory structure, the use of modules, testing, communication with a RESTful API in the back-end, security, etc. It is a 100% MEAN application !:).

angular__resources.title: Tutorial for your first Angular application
angular__resources.description: This tutorial includes a template for your first Angular application. It has a step-by-step guide to building an Angular application using all the basic concepts.

angular__resources.title: Free Angular course
angular__resources.description: In this course you will learn in a dynamic way all the necessary concepts to build your own Angular applications. It includes exercises and real application examples.

angular__resources.title: NGXS library
angular__resources.description: NGXS is a state management pattern + library for Angular. It acts as a single source of truth for your application's state, providing simple rules for predictable state mutations. NGXS is modeled after the CQRS pattern popularly implemented in libraries like Redux and NgRx but reduces boilerplate by using modern TypeScript features such as classes and decorators.

angular__resources.title: RxWeb: reactive forms validators
angular__resources.description: RxWeb Reactive Form Validators provides all types of complex, conditional, cross-field and dynamic validation on validator-based reactive forms, model-based reactive forms and template-driven forms.

angular__challenges.title: Online shop
angular__challenges.description: In this challenge, you have tou build a online shop with CRUD operations.
requeriments: Minimum components: header, footer, home page and products page
Each product card will have title, image, price and a button to edit.
CRUD operations through a reactive form.

angular__challenges.title: Booking system
angular__challenges.description: In this challenge you have to build the booking system for a hairdresser.
requeriments: User logging
The homepage will have a calendar (days and hours) to do a booking
Administrator user will have a management page to see all bookings
Each booking will be identified with the user name, date and time
Administrator user can edit and delete the bookings

angular__challenges.title: Movies ranking
angular__challenges.description: In this challenge you have to build a movies ranking where users can insert films or vote.
requeriments: User logging
Each movie card will have: title, image, abstract, gender, year, rating and button to score (only visible for registered users)
Non-registered users will only be able to view information about the film, including the rating
Registered users will be able to rate each film. Clicking the button will open a popup where you can select a rating from 1 to 5
The score of each film will be the average of all the votes

angular__challenges.title: Rick and Morty API
angular__challenges.description: In this challenge you have read data form Rick and Morty API and display it dynamically.
requeriments: Use API: https://rickandmortyapi.com/
Show a card for each character with its name and image
Hover effect on each card to show more information
Registered users will be able to rate each film. Clicking the button will open a popup where you can select a rating from 1 to 5
Character serach (by name)

react__resources.title: Official React repository
react__resources.description: In the Github repository, you can check out the React source code whenever you need it. If you want to stay informed about the current state of development, you can also take a look at issues, milestones and latest requests. If you're stuck, it might also be a good idea to take a look at the Troubleshooting Guide.

react__resources.title: React Styleguidist
react__resources.description: React Styleguidist allows you to quickly generate a styleguide for your application. Simply type the component's README.md into MDX and the generator will take care of the rest.

react__resources.title: React course with 15 projects
react__resources.description: In this course you will learn the basics of React including redux, hooks, application deployment, APIs consumption... You will also learn MongoDB notions and build 15 applications.

react__resources.title: Material UI library
react__resources.description: Material Design is the design standard that Google uses in its web and mobile applications and, for its Angular framework, they launched Angular Material at the time. Material UI is nothing more than the user interface library that seeks to apply Material Design on React. Therefore, we could say that it is the React equivalent of Angular Material and it has the same pros and cons.

react__resources.title: React testing library
react__resources.description: The React Testing Library has become the standard for testing React in conjunction with Jest. Developed by the famous React programmer Kent C. Dodds, its main advantage and why it is so widely used by the React community is because it is a library that encourages the use of good testing practices. That is, it does not focus on testing how the code is implemented, but on testing from a user perspective.

react__resources.title: React portfolio template
react__resources.description: Template to build your own portfolio with React. It includes all the necessary libraries, the project structure created, components and routes between them.

react__challenges.title: Digital clock / countdown timer / stopwatch
react__challenges.description: In this challenge you will create an application that includes a digital clock, a countdown timer and a stopwatch through 3 different components using hooks.
requeriments: 3 components: one for each functionality

The digital clock component will get the local time information via the date.toLocaleTimeString() method. The value collected will be the value applied to clockState via setClockState every 1000 milliseconds
The countdown component is given a specific date and time and will calculate the time remaining until it reaches 0
The stopwatch component shall have functions to initialise, pause, resume and restart

react__challenges.title: Units of measure calculator
react__challenges.description: In this challenge you have to build an app to convert length, weight and time measurements.
requeriments: The main component will have an input to enter the quantity and two drop-down lists to select the unit of origin and the unit to convert

react__challenges.title: Weather APP
react__challenges.description: In this challenge you have to build an application to consult the weather.
requeriments: Use API OpenWeatherMap
The data displayed will be current temperature, minimum temperature, maximum temperature and relative humidity
